{"step_by_step_thinking": "The occlusal clearance of an onlay refers to the space between the onlay and the opposing teeth when the patient bites down. To detect the occlusal clearance, depth cuts can be made on the preparation to measure the distance between the onlay and the opposing teeth. Visual inspection can also be used to assess the clearance, but it may not provide accurate measurements. Wax chew-in involves having the patient bite down on a wax material to check for any interference or contact between the onlay and the opposing teeth. Articulating paper is used to mark the occlusal contacts and check for any high spots or interference. Based on the options provided, the best method to detect the occlusal clearance of an onlay is D. Articulating paper.", "answer_choice": "D"}
